title: Today in class
author: Sam G
body:
Today in class, we worked on 'fixing' the user end the local School District cloud. They have an online Software as a Service (SaaS) application, that acts like an online desktop. The desktop has a tiles that activate various web apps. One of them lets you see your grades, another one lets you see your schedule, and your attendence record, et cetera.

The draw is that the desktop is customizable; you can add your on tiles and such. The whole application, however is poorly designed. There is no input sanitation. If you have a double-quote in the user-defined title of the tile (which gets inserted in the JSON by the server).

{"title": "title has double-quote here " that is embedded in some text", "other":" fields}

Which as you can see, invalidates the whole script.

Furthermore, the title for the tiles gets embedded in the web page, so if you add a tile with HTML tags in the title, the HTML tags will be rendered. We could really mess with the style. We even embedded other websites in the web desktop using HTML iframes.
